result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:32 PM Defendant Wilson J Rivera Jr. in court, in custody from the Vilas County Jail.  Attorney Paul J Augustyn appeared by video for Wilson J Rivera Jr.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney is withdrawing speedy trial demand for 22CF65. Requesting judicial pre trial to be set in all matters. Bond continued.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

records.addlTxt:
2:13 PM Defendant Wilson J Rivera Jr. in court, in custody with the Vilas County Jail.  Attorney Paul J Augustyn appeared by video for Wilson J Rivera Jr.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Defense/Court speak to the cases. Defense requesting another status hearing to review discovery, speak to client and district attorney's office. Defendant makes a statement. Bond continued.
Status hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

11:00 AM Defendant Wilson J Rivera Jr. in court, in custody.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 22CF65, 22CF68 and 22CF69.  Victim rights complied with. No victim appearing today for 22CF68. Court speaks to the cases. Court appoints an attorney in 22CF68 and 22CF69. Court will be looking into if defendant would have to pay the cost of court appointed attorney since indigent. Court speaks to 22CF65 motion to joinder. Court does not make a ruling until court appointed counsel is assigned. Right to counsel explained to defendant in 22CF65.  Defendant confirms that he would like to proceed with an attorney.  Court finds the defendant is withdrawing the waiver of counsel request. Court notes that 22CF65 goes first to trial.
Status hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Public Defender Status of Counsel Report - 734 contacts

1:48 PM Defendant Wilson J Rivera Jr. in court, in custody with the Vilas County Jail.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 22CF65, 22CF68, 22CF69 and 22CV41. Court speaks to the public defender representation contacts. Defendant requests to be pro se in 22CF65 and seek public defender representation in the other cases. Court provides the states motion for jointer for all three cases to defendant. Defendant speaks to the timing of the motion being filed. Defendant speaks to his request for bond modification. State objects to the bond modification. Court denies motion for modification of bond. Court will here motion for jointer tomorrow and waiver to an attorney. Defendant speaks to the motion requesting property being returned - State will take that up with law enforcement. Court denies motion for property being returned. Bond continued.
Public Defender Status of Counsel Report - 734 contacts
for bond modification

2:51 PM Defendant Wilson J Rivera Jr. in court, in custody Vilas County Jail.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Court hears defendants motion to appear pro se on case 22CF65, 22CF68 and 22CF69 defendant also files motion for bond modification and a speedy trial. State to file motion to combine the 3 listed cases.  Court reviews bond in all 3 cases and hears statements from defendant and the state.  Court denies motion to modify bond.  Bond continued in all cases.
Motion hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.
